issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Appcelerator CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Tooling and the CLI here

fields.description: When doing a dev build using the CLI, iOS does not minify unless requested while android runs minify by default.
fields.summary: [CLI] --skip-js-minify should be default on android build

comments.body:
Starting in Titanium SDK 3.2.0, both iOS and Android do NOT minify JavaScript for simulator/emulator builds. However, both iOS and Android DO minify JavaScript for device and distribution builds. You can disable JavaScript minification for device and distribution builds by using the --skip-js-minify flag. The --skip-js-minify flag has no effect for simulator/emulator builds.

I am planning on implementing build configurations as apart of TIMOB-12025. The heart of that task is to decouple deploy type from things like JavaScript minification. You'll be able to control several knobs for the various deploy type/build configurations.
